definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: Doggerel comes from popularized scholar poetry and folk poetry.
sentences.chinese: 打油诗文体源于文人诗歌的俗化和大众诗歌。

sentences.english: This rhymster has written mainly doggerel .
sentences.chinese: 这个所谓诗作者主要写打油诗。

sentences.english: Then look in the library or on the Internet to find more limericks.
sentences.chinese: 然后到图书馆或上网查找更多的打油诗。

sentences.english: She wrote serious poetry, but also loved composing limericks .
sentences.chinese: 她写严肃题材的诗歌，但也喜欢创作打油诗。
他把他的这首诗歌叫做打油诗。

sentences.english: Or God will toss off a limerick for your pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 或者上帝为了使你高兴而抛出一首五行打油诗。
后人将这类诗歌称为“打油诗”。
这首打油诗没有标明作者是谁。

definition: popular piece of doggerel/common phrase repeated as a jingle
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line
to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines/abbr. to 七律
rhyming couplet/pair of lines of verse written vertically down the sides of a doorway/CL:副[fu4],幅[fu2]
a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
